content: The "Student Loan Fair Prepayment Act" allows for the application of prepayment amounts for FFEL and Direct Loans. Eligible borrowers must apply prepayment amounts towards the loan with the highest principal balance. Eligible borrowers are those with no outstanding fees on any loan under this part or part B. The amendment requires prepayment amounts from non-eligible borrowers to be applied towards outstanding fees, collection costs, and late charges on loans held by the same holder. Exceptions include income-based and income contingent repayment plans. The amendment specifies that prepayment amounts for Perkins loans from non-eligible borrowers must be used for outstanding fees, collection costs, and late charges, with exceptions for certain repayment plans. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to require institutions to use excess payments from borrowers with no outstanding balance for prepayment of loans with different interest rates. The Higher Education Act of 1965 now mandates institutions to use excess payments from borrowers with no outstanding balance to prepay loans with the highest interest rates, unless otherwise requested by the borrower. The institution must apply excess payments from borrowers without outstanding balances to prepay the loan with the highest principal balance, unless the borrower requests otherwise in writing. Section 128(e) of the Truth in Lending Act is amended to include the application of prepayment amounts for private education loans held by the same holder with different interest rates. The amendment to Section 128(e) of the Truth in Lending Act addresses the application of prepayment amounts for private education loans held by the same holder with different interest rates. The amendment to Section 128(e) of the Truth in Lending Act regulates prepayment amounts for private education loans, prioritizing repayment towards the loan with the highest principal balance. Exceptions apply if the borrower has outstanding fees on any loan held by the same holder. The borrower's payment amount is first applied towards outstanding fees, collection costs, and late charges on any private education loan held by the same holder.
